column2: Which month have you been selected to show at?
column3: What is the title of your project
column4: How is the title of your project pronounced?
column5: What are the names, name pronunciations, and pronouns of the developers you want credited during announcements?
column10: Additional Links or Social Media Handles

column6: Inferno is a fire-fueled 2D platformer where betrayal ignites transformation. Play as Kai, a Sergeant in the Krorion Space Forces, searching for his traitorous commanding officer. Run, jump, dash, and FIRE to unleash Sergeant Kai’s Inferno power against devastating odds.
column13: CJ (he/him) is an artist born and raised in Texas. He is a graphic designer by profession and works in the world of graphic design. He has been in game development since 2016, only ever working on one game, Inferno. Inspired by his love for 90’s anime and manga, as well as traditional 2D platformers, he hopes to bring those styles over to Inferno.

column5: Ian (ee-uhn) Hawthorne (haw-thorn) (He/Him), Camille (k-uh-M-EE-L) Hawthorne (haw-thorn) (She/Her), Avery (ay-vurree) Luther (loo-thur) (She/Her), Miles (meye-lz) Fritzmather (fr-its-mah-ther) (He/Him), Reese (r-ee-s) Fritzmather (fr-its-mah-ther) (He/Him), Zoe (zo-ee) Jonakin (jon-uh-kin) (She/Her), Max (max) Wang (wang) (He/Him)
column6: Abaddon is a dungeon crawler inspired by old 80's adventure games like Moria and Legends of Zelda. As you explore the destroyed world you learn more about its past and people as a failure of the gods. Dive into the caves, fight creatures of the depth, and complete quests to help save the world from its own darkness.
column11: Abaddon Group (Side note: we don't really have a name - we haven't decided on one)
column13: Abaddon is a project comprised of a team of teenagers, with the oldest being 18 and the youngest being 15. Camille (17) is the producer and lead designer who mainly works on level and narrative design, while Luke (16) does systems design. There are 3 programmers -- Miles (18), Max (15), and Ian (15) -- with Ian as the lead. Reese (16) is our lead artist who focuses on animations and world art, while Zoie (16) does character, NPC, and item art, along with some SFX work. Avery (16) is our sound designer and composer.

column5: Made by Ledbetter Games and 14 other Dev teams from the Playdate Pulp community
column6:
In Ware-wolf Campfire Stories, 5 kids are sitting around a fire with their counselor telling spoooooky tales! Each story launches a separate game that you may win or lose.... with consequences. 

It was made as a Halloween Treat for the Playdate Community and is FREE to download!
column13: Ledbetter Games produces unique play experiences like invisible platformers, art galleries, hybrid 90s era board games and puppy feeding simulators. This project includes work from 14 additional Playdate dev teams, collectively termed - the Ware-wolves.

column5: Ted Anderson (Ted And-er-son), George Cheal (George Cheel), Ezra Weller (Ezz-rah Well-er)
column6: A tropical anti-gravity racing game from the depths of a long-lost arcade cabinet that will have you cruising through lush, remote Polynesian islands with a draft-based boost system that fosters tight-knit competition between players
column13: Pixel Pushers Union 512 is a worker-owned independent game development team behind the acclaimed title "Tonight We Riot."

column6:
Score goals to paint the arena in Dyebreaker, the arcade "air hockey platformer" inspired by screen print poster art! Slam and sling dye-soaked pucks, drive your color across randomized, interactive stages, and print a poster unique to your team. 

Pick from 10 colorful characters across 5 playable teams, each with a signature graphic design style. Swap team colors at any time, reskinning not just your character but the entire game. First art wins!
column13:
running jump is Walt Mitchell. Walt works professionally as a software engineer for videogames when not designing his own. 

Walt is a member of Arcade Commons, a nonprofit collective of artists and creators making independent arcade games. Dyebreaker was originally developed as a physical arcade cabinet which can currently be found at Wonderville in Brooklyn, NY. A second cabinet was built for Oddwood Brewing here in Austin. 

Dyebreaker was created by Walt Mitchell (design and development), illustrator and animator Ramsey Haefner (UI and character design), DJ and composer Devin Curry (sound and music), and multidisciplinary artist Matt Fry (cabinet design and fabrication).

column6: This interactive narrative is based on the concept of “false awakenings” which is the experience of waking up from one dream only to find oneself stuck in another. The player must navigate through different dream rooms in order to escape and wake up. The only way out is through...
column13: I am a Communication Design Senior from Texas State University. I created this interactive narrative game for my Interactive III class led by Nishra Ranpura.

column5: Isaias Perez (Pronounced like Izayus) he-him, Communication Design, Texas State University
column6: Welcome to Somniant, an archival company that stores dreams in filing cabinets. Inspired by the "I Spy" books, find objects inside of dreams in order to help clients recall their memories. This prototype includes one level.
column13: I'm Isaias. I'm a 3D hobbyist and I want to be a product designer. This year I started learning Godot, but my game here was prototyped in Figma. I'm into VR tech and other experimental modes of game-play.

column5: Texas State University Communication Design, Maggie Brigleb (Mah-gee Brig-leb) they/them/she/her
column6: Experience your first ever critique as a Graphic Design student. Spend the morning working through your nerves, talking to friends, and prepping to present as you make your way through the halls to class. As you discuss your project, respond to critiques from students and professors to the best of your ability without taking it personally. See how your decisions and reactions effect the presentation, and remember to keep it professional!
column13: I'm a senior Communication Design student at Texas State University. My academic and professional focus is in UX/UI, and I have experience in painting and illustration as personal creative outlets. I'm playing Baldurs Gate 3 right now, (slowly,) and have my sights set on Disco Elysium when I have the time, but I primarily have been playing any small indie games I come across on itch.io that catch my eye.
